result.execSummary:
The defendant Todd A Lund was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
$250.00 cash bond to be applied towards Court costs.
Attorney Fees To Be Determined.  
In the event of non-payment of outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Defendant Todd A Lund in court with attorney Laura Ann Sutton.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State moves to amend to remove the domestic abuse enhancer. Court grants amendment. 
Defendant pleads guilty to the amended charge. Court accepts the plea and finds the Defendant guilty. 
Argument by State. 

Court relates and orders: 
Costs. 
$250.00 cash bond to be applied.  
Order for DNA given to the defendant in court.
